definition[0]: the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively
example[0]: the integration of data from other surveys
definition[1]: when people become part of a group or society and are accepted by them
example[1]: The family unit is supported by its integration into a wider social network.
definition[2]: the process of getting people of different races to live and work together instead of separately
definition[3]: the combining of two or more organizations, activities etc so that they become more effective, make better profits etc
example[3]: The important achievement of the European Union is economic integration, but political integration is doubtful.
definition[4]: when a company obtains control of its suppliers, customers, or competitors, resulting in fewer companies in an industry
example[4]: Following the merger, further integration of the European packaging industry is inevitable.
